page.title: 19Thomas Russell Cent. Barton
page.content: On 16th June, celebrations began with a church service to the mark centenary of Thomas Russell School.Although the original building now houses only the Infants, both schools,Thomas Russell Junior and Thomas Russell Infant, took part in activities which lasted a week. In preparation, classrooms depicted life of the past hundred years in a display of writing,photographs and many articles of interest.Children and their teachers all dressed in Victorian costume.The girls wore black tights or long socks,winter shoes or lace-up boots and a white pinafore worn over a dark dress.The boys wore knickerboker- type trousers tucked into long socks, lace-up shoes,a shirt,a neckerchief,a waistcoat,boots and cap.Victorian activities included a games afternoon,a picnic,a garden party,a music hall and school open days.
